result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent M Weger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL NOTES:  Attorney fee on case 16CF119.

Order for payment of Atty. Joseph Fischer as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $1020.62. One order for cases  16CM171 & 16CF119    cc: DA (electronically), DOC, Atty Fischer, Defendant   /tn 2-24-17
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Fischer in the amount of $1020.62.
with  elements
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #16CM171 and #16CF119 called at 10:18am. 
Defendant Brent M Weger in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Through court staff, the Court verifies with Branch III that it may proceed with final hearing in Case #16CM171 which is assigned to Branch III/Judge Wambach.  

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered in #16CF119 and in #16CM171; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

In Case #16CF119, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Weger on Probation for 30 months.
In Case #16CM171, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Weger on Probation for 12 months.
Conditions in both cases are:
--no contact with the victims KAL (dob 12/29/1992) or Kathryn Draves 
--to complete a psychosexual evaluation and follow through with recommended treatment; this evaluation is to be completed within the first ninety days of the Probation term, however the Probation Agent may allow a short extension of this time limit for financial reasons
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to reimburse Jefferson County for court-appointed attorney fees 
--to pay costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
As to Case #16CF119 only:  the Court grants Mr. Weger expungement under Statute 973.015.
Felony firearm firearms/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 10:48am.
Status conference on October 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:58am. 
Attorney Joseph F Fischer appears by telephone.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court learned from its staff that Attorney Fischer mistakenly believed that the Request for Substitution filed in #16CF119 also included this misdemeanor case number; because of this Attorney Fischer and Mr. Weger do not personally appear today. 
Attorney Fischer requests that this case be rescheduled for Status Confrence. 
The Court directs Attorney Fischer to speak with Mr. Weger about Mr. Weger's failure to make the requirement installment payments for reimbursement of court-appointed attorney fees.   
recess 11:02am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 10/4/16 at 9:00am
Court's response to Memo from Bookkeeping RE: Failure to Comply with Court Order : Address the non-compliance at the next hearing
FINANCIAL: from Bkpg to Judge; Re: Failure to Comply with Court Order to make Attorney Fee Trust payments. (Covers 16CM171 & 16CF119)
State's
Status conference on August 9, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case16CF119 and 16CM171 called together at 1:58pm [mo]
Defendant Brent M Weger in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 
As to 16CF119:
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

As to 16CM171:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Not guilty plea entered; speedy trial waived

The Court requires a $500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Kathryn Draves
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess: 2:02pm

NEXT:   AS TO BOTH CASES: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/8/16 at 11:00am   (2) Status Conference on 8/9/16 at 10:30am
Initial appearance on May 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
for Continuance

for Continuance of the presently scheduled Initial Appearance on May 24, 2016
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

The petiton is GRANTED because the Court finds the person is currently indigent. An attorney shall be appointed at county expense as set forth below. The person shall be required to reimburse the county for such representation as follows: Repayment at the rate of $100 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 5-20-2016. Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court. Attorney Joseph Fischer is appointed to represent the defendant.
Attorney Joseph Fischer
